case_vignette: A 24-year-old woman comes to the emergency department because of lower abdominal pain for 4 hours. She has had vaginal spotting for 2 days. Menses occur at irregular 20- to 45-day intervals and last for 3 to 7 days. Her last menstrual period was 8 weeks ago. She was treated for pelvic inflammatory disease at the age of 20 years with ceftriaxone and azithromycin. She is sexually active with one male partner and uses condoms inconsistently. Her pulse is 118/min, respirations are 20/min, and blood pressure is 118/66 mm Hg. Examination shows lower abdominal tenderness. Pelvic examination shows a closed cervix and a uterus of normal size with right adnexal tenderness. Her serum β-human chorionic gonadotropin concentration is 16,000 mIU/mL (N < 5). Transvaginal ultrasonography shows a 5-cm hypoechoic lesion at the junction of the fallopian tube and uterine cavity with a 3-mm layer of myometrium surrounding it.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Obstetrics and Gynecology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been experiencing lower abdominal pain for 4 hours and I've also had some vaginal spotting for the past 2 days.
Are you currently pregnant or could you be pregnant?
My last menstrual period was 8 weeks ago, and I've been sexually active, although not always using protection consistently.
Do you have any history of pelvic inflammatory disease or sexually transmitted infections?
Yes, I was treated for pelvic inflammatory disease when I was 20 years old.
Have you noticed any unusual vaginal discharge or an unpleasant odor?
No, I haven't mentioned anything about unusual vaginal discharge or an unpleasant odor.
Do you have any history of ectopic pregnancy?
No, I haven't mentioned having a history of ectopic pregnancy.
**Final Diagnosis:** Possible ectopic pregnancy
